text: [Music]
well I was interviewed in the Harvard
Business for you and ask a question what
is the number one problem of the people
you coach and the answer is winning too
much what's that mean if it's important
we want to win meaningful we want to win
critical we want to win trivial we want
to to win not worth it we want to win
anyway we like winning I have a case
study that I give with my clients and
75% fail and when I say fail they fail
themselves case study goes like this you
want to go to dinner at Restaurant X
your husband wife partner friend or
significant other wants to go to dinner
at restaurant why have a heated argument
you go to restaurant why it's not your
choice the food tastes awful the service
is terrible option A critique the food
point out your partner was wrong this
mistake could been avoided had only they
listen to me me me option b shut up eat
the stupid food try to enjoy it and have
a nice evening what would I do what
should I do 75% of my clients what would
I do critique the food what should I do
shut up it's incredibly difficult for
smart successful people not to
constantly go through life and
Win Second major factor is what it's
related to the first called adding too
much value I'm young smart enthusiastic
I report to you I come to you with an
idea you think it's a great idea rather
than saying great idea our natural
tendency is to say that is a nice idea
why don't you add this to it well the
problem is the quality of the idea may
go up 5% my commitment to its execution
may now go down 50% it's no longer my
idea incredibly difficult for smart
successful people not to constantly go
through life adding value one of my
clients is CEO of a large pharmaceutical
company I asked him what did you learn
about leadership as a CEO in said I
learned a very hard lesson as a CEO my
suggestions become orders my suggestions
become orders he said if they're smart
they're orders they're stupid they're
orders if I want them to be orders they
are orders if I do not want them to be
orders they're orders anyway the higher
we Mo move up into leadership the more
we need to realize our suggestions
become orders and I ask him what did you
learn from me when I was your coach that
helped you the most he said you taught
me one lesson that helped me be a better
executive
and be a happier person I said what was
it he said ' before I speak stop and
breathe and I asked myself one question
is it worth it and he said as CEO of
this company 50% of the time I have the
discipline to stop and breathe and ask
is it worth it what do I decide am I
right maybe is it worth it
